page.title: 16Marton & Birdingbury,Survey.
page.content: We carried out a survey in Marton and Birdingbury to find out to what extent the villages are self sufficient.We discovered that most people do their major shopping in a large supermarket but they do use their village shops regularly.The post offices are in constant use with all but one person questioned using them every week. About half of the people made use of the village pubs and attended functions in the village halls. All those questioned used pubs outside the villages and attended social functions elsewhere.A majority felt that the villages were well equipped with play facilities for children.Most asked did not use the bus service often or at all and overwhelmingly felt they could not live happily in the area without a car.We concluded that tha villages are not self-sufficient.
